purposeFailureMessage: Warning! It will not be possible to obtain an access token for this purpose. One or more components are currently suspended. Suspended components:

uploadKey.message: No keys found, it will not be possible to obtain an access token. To upload your first key, go to

description.label: The first step is to create an assertion that is signed with the private key that corresponds to one of the public keys uploaded for this client. More details to create the JWS below

kidField.label: KID
kidField.description: The public key that corresponds to the private key you will use to sign the assertion

algField.label: ALG
algField.description: The algorythm that will be used to sign this JWT. Currently only RS256 is available

typField.label: TYP
typField.description: The type of object that can be sent, in this case “JWT”

issField.label: ISS
issField.description: The issuer, in this case the client id

subField.label: SUB
subField.description: The subject, in this case still the client id

purposeIdField.label: PurposeId
purposeIdField.description: The id of the purpose for which you will request access to the E-Service Provider

jtiField.label: JTI
jtiField.description: The JWT ID, a randomic unique id (uuid) that is generated by who creates the token. It is used to univocally track the token. It is upon the caller to ensure that the id is in fact unique
jtiField.suggestionLabel: You must generate this parameter yourself. Example value: 261cd445-3da6-421b-9ef4-7ba556efda5f

iatField.label: IAT
iatField.description: Issued at, the timestamp bearing the date and hour when the token was generated. It is expressed in UNIX epoch (numeric value, not a string)
iatField.suggestionLabel: You must generate this parameter yourself. Example value: 1651659340

expField.label: EXP
expField.description: Expiration, the timestamp bearing the date and hour when the token expires. It is expressed in UNIX epoch (numeric value, not a string)
expField.suggestionLabel: You must generate this parameter yourself. Example value: 1651738540

assertionScript.title: Example script to generate an assertion
assertionScript.tempMoreLanguagesAlert: More script with examples in other languages will be added

step2.title: Access token
step2.consumerDescription: In the previous step, you obtained a JWS signed with your private key. Now it will be used to make an access token request towards the Interoperability authorization server. It all is fine, an access token will be generated. It can be spent on the Provider E-Service

apiDescription.message: In the previous step, you obtained a JWS signed with your private key. Now it will be used to make an access token request towards the Interoperability authorization server. It all is fine, an access token will be generated. It can be spent on the Provider E-Service

clientAssertionField.label: Client_assertion
clientAssertionField.suggestionLabel: The JWS obtained at step 1 (starts with “ey”)

clientAssertionTypeField.label: Client_assertion_type
clientAssertionTypeField.description: The client assertion format, as stated in the RFC

grantTypeField.label: Grant_type
grantTypeField.description: The flow used, as stated in the RFC

accessTokenScript.title: cURL example
accessTokenScript.description: Replace the placeholder with the assertion obtained at step 1 and run the cURL

consumer.title: Access the Provider E-Service
consumer.description: The access token obtained can be spent on the Provider E-Service

audField.label: AUD
audField.description: The audience of the Provider E-Service

api.title: Interoperability API gateway access
api.description: The access token obtained can be spent on the Interoperability API gateway

link.label: OpenAPI Interface
link.title: Link to the Interoperability API gateway OpenAPI file specification
